metadata.synopsis: Jaheira's default dialogue. Topics range from her past life to her current goals as they develop. Unless otherwise stated, her tone is confident and to the point. She's a seasoned adventurer with a sardonic sense of humour - and a little less cynical than she might present herself to be.

52.speaker: Jaheira
52.text: The threat of spanking never kept the children from poking through my things. Why should it deter you?

104.speaker: Jaheira
104.text: The threat of spanking never kept the children from poking through my things. Why should it deter you?

26.speaker: Jaheira
26.text: It is... a ritual. Or it describes one, at least. Practised by druids of certain esoteric circles.

62.speaker: Jaheira
62.text: If they be learned, and powerful enough, the practitioner of this ritual might slow their ageing. Extend their life well beyond its natural reach.

64.speaker: Jaheira
64.text: In greener days, I might have been strong enough to do it. I might be yet, with the right preparations.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: So you plan to do it?

50.speaker: Jaheira
50.text: I make no plans. Only... contingencies.

70.speaker: Jaheira
70.text: Do not look at me like that. I have been content to see the span of my natural years - a privilege far too few in this world can claim.

13.speaker: Jaheira
13.text: I do not speaking of clinging to life for its own sake. I just... look back on that life's work, and I wonder - is it done?

118.speaker: Jaheira
118.text: The Dead Three plague the world still. The city still falls prey to small minds like Gortash, or lost souls like Orin.

103.speaker: Jaheira
103.text: It is every Harper's hope to be a light that drives out darkness. But I've lived long enough to see so many of those lights burn out, while the shadows cling stubbornly on.

28.speaker: Jaheira
28.text: Knowing that - isn't it our duty to burn on if we can? To fight for as long as we are able?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: You have more in common with my people than you'd think. On the Astral Plane, our finest knights can live for millennia - and they devote every thought to vanquishing ghaik.

92.speaker: Lae'zel
92.text: You have more in common with my people than you'd think. On the Astral Plane, our finest knights can live for millennia - and they devote every thought to vanquishing ghaik.

71.speaker: Jaheira
71.text: Or pleasing their own Undying Queen - who lives on to serve... what purpose, exactly?

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.text: The darkness will prevail in the end, Jaheira. You're clinging on just to wage an unwinnable war.
105.context: NodeContext: 'I wallowed...' = SH has turned from Shar. 'The darkness will prevail' = SH is loyal to Shar

87.speaker: Jaheira
87.text: Perhaps. But if the darkness is really going to swallow everything, as you Sharrans say, it should at least have to work for its supper.

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: Immortality is only as good as the life you're living. An eternity of luxury sounds a lot better than an eternity of struggle.
112.context: NodeContext: Mournful - referring back to Mystra's request he blow himself up

74.speaker: Jaheira
74.text: I'd have thought time would dull either, but I suppose I should know better than to argue with an immortal.

95.speaker: Wyll
95.text: I'd cling to life forever if it means I could keep Baldur's Gate safe. But time marches me to a different fate.
95.context: NodeContext: Mournful - referring back to Mystra's request he blow himself up

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.text: And if it does? That does not mean you cannot dig your heels in a little.

108.speaker: Gale
108.text: Your duty, perhaps. Mine was quite the opposite. Every breath I take - however gratefully -  is proof of my dereliction.
108.context: NodeContext: Mournful - referring back to Mystra's request he blow himself up

27.speaker: Jaheira
27.text: Or proof that you plan to fight on, rather than take the easier path.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: You're preaching to the doomed choir, ma'am.
90.context: NodeContext: Dry, self-deprecating, Halsin put it better than she could have.

106.speaker: Jaheira
106.text: You've done more than your share of fighting already, Karlach. If there is one person I would trust to make the most of a longer life, it is you.

117.speaker: Halsin
117.text: To wish to live is natural, but so too is to let go, when the moment arrives.
117.context: NodeContext: Dry, self-deprecating, Halsin put it better than she could have.

38.speaker: Jaheira
38.text: You see? I should know better than to philosophize in the company of an archdruid.
38.context: NodeContext: Dry, self-deprecating, Halsin put it better than she could have.

116.speaker: Minsc
116.text: Minsc does not understand the question. You will live forever, Jaheira.
116.context: NodeContext: Humble three figures - SH references full elves' much longer lifespan, Jaheira is only a half-elf.

3.speaker: Jaheira
3.text: Of course I will, berserker. And you will sprout soft and golden locks from that shining skull.
3.context: NodeContext: Humble three figures - SH references full elves' much longer lifespan, Jaheira is only a half-elf.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Live forever? I'd be curious to hit four figures,  but it might get a little dull after that.
99.context: NodeContext: Humble three figures - SH references full elves' much longer lifespan, Jaheira is only a half-elf.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Live forever? I'd be curious to hit four figures,  but it might get a little dull after that.
83.context: NodeContext: Humble three figures - SH references full elves' much longer lifespan, Jaheira is only a half-elf.

29.speaker: Jaheira
29.text: Here I stand on only the humble three, half-cousin. But I hope I've filled them with my fair share of living.
29.context: NodeContext: Humble three figures - SH references full elves' much longer lifespan, Jaheira is only a half-elf.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I'd consider it. I could achieve great things with another lifetime or ten...
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira produces another rolled-up scroll and holds it up on 'I turned to my research again',. (no unfurling)

17.speaker: Jaheira
17.text: If the bards are right, then I've already done my share of deeds. But I can assure you, the work only ever feels half-finished at best.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira produces another rolled-up scroll and holds it up on 'I turned to my research again',. (no unfurling)

2.speaker: Jaheira
2.text: In truth, I had put this ritual from my mind - until Last Light. Trapped in that darkness, I turned to my research again: what if I was a little stronger? As fast as I once had been?
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira produces another rolled-up scroll and holds it up on 'I turned to my research again',. (no unfurling)

82.text: Then you came, and made the question moot. But I kept this - just in case, I told myself. A final resort.
82.context: NodeContext: Explaining why she was hedging her bets - she'd grown cynical

91.speaker: Jaheira
91.text: Then you came, and made the question moot. But I kept this - just in case, I told myself. A final resort.
91.context: NodeContext: Explaining why she was hedging her bets - she'd grown cynical

63.speaker: Jaheira
63.text: Perhaps you were not the saviour you seemed. I had learned better than to think of life as some simple tale, after all. There is no guarantee of happy endings, or true heroes.
63.context: NodeContext: Explaining why she was hedging her bets - she'd grown cynical

41.speaker: Jaheira
41.text: I believe that still. But, when I look on all we have achieved since, I wonder... perhaps it is not heroes we need. Only people who are willing to try.
41.context: NodeContext: Mulling it over, telling us how she's changed her mind. She's chosen not to extend her life, because she's shown us someone will always come along to help - she's not needed, and a little amused at her own self-importance.

42.speaker: Jaheira
42.text: I do not know what manner of story that makes. But I do know that, without an ending, it would be no story at all.
42.context: NodeContext: acknowledging this is maybe not as sexy as spinning a big tale of good and evil

96.speaker: Jaheira
96.text: So I will accept mine, when and however it comes. As for the this city's story, well...

45.speaker: Jaheira
45.text: I worried that perhaps you were not the saviour you seemed. That Minsc was gone forever, and my family was doomed to see the city they love fall.
45.context: NodeContext: Mulling it over, telling us how she's changed her mind. She's chosen not to extend her life, because she's shown us someone will always come along to help - she's not needed, and a little amused at her own self-importance.

37.speaker: Jaheira
37.text: Only, now - when I look at this, and think of all we have done, I realise: I was not worried. Not even afraid. I was arrogant.
37.context: NodeContext: Mulling it over, telling us how she's changed her mind. She's chosen not to extend her life, because she's shown us someone will always come along to help - she's not needed, and a little amused at her own self-importance.

55.speaker: Jaheira
55.text: This city does not need me. It just needs someone. Baldur's Gate will never truly be saved, once and for all - but whatever it will be...
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: BRONZE VERSION: Jaheira puts the scroll away again (construct anim.)

122.text: Well. That is entirely your problem now, cub.
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: BRONZE VERSION: Jaheira puts the scroll away again (construct anim.)

80.text: Well. That is entirely your problem now, cub.
80.context: NodeContext: Wry, fond - she's not denying that Karlach is dying or offering false comfort, but expressing respect for how Karlach deals with it.

14.speaker: Jaheira
14.text: Well. That is entirely your problem now, cub.
14.context: NodeContext: Wry, fond - she's not denying that Karlach is dying or offering false comfort, but expressing respect for how Karlach deals with it.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I accept - for as long as I'm able, at least.
68.context: NodeContext: Wry, fond - she's not denying that Karlach is dying or offering false comfort, but expressing respect for how Karlach deals with it.

35.speaker: Jaheira
35.text: Death is a piss-poor excuse not to live. Who do you think I learned that from?
35.context: NodeContext: Wry, fond - she's not denying that Karlach is dying or offering false comfort, but expressing respect for how Karlach deals with it.

114.speaker: Jaheira
114.text: But I do not plan on going anywhere just yet. And besides - you still have a tadpole in your skull. You are almost certainly going to die first.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I'm honoured you think of me that way.

72.speaker: Jaheira
72.text: Hah! Do not thank me for slinging a weight around your neck. I might start to feel bad.

94.speaker: Jaheira
94.text: I do mean what I say - but I am also a Harper. In every honeyed word, there is a hook.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: You're not off the hook that easily, Jaheira. I want you around for a long time yet.

44.speaker: Jaheira
44.text: I have no plans to lie down and die. Well - perhaps a little lying down, when all of this is done.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Enough of this cub stuff. My people live longer than yours, half-elf.

97.speaker: Jaheira
97.text: And age better too. She who is most weathered is also most wise.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: A pity. I could have used a young and powerful Jaheira.

89.speaker: Jaheira
89.text: Do not be so sure. I was not always so soft and agreeable as I have become.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Don't get ahead of yourself. First we have to survive the Absolute.

48.speaker: Jaheira
48.text: And death might find us any moment. If I cannot meet it with a bit of cheerful futility, why bother being a Harper at all?

39.speaker: Jaheira
39.text: Something kept me from throwing it away. A fear, perhaps, that you were not the saviour you seemed to be.
39.context: NodeContext: Alt scroll branch - she now WILL keep it, because we've proven to be violent and a little psychopathic at times. No venom or accusation in this - she's partof it too.

76.speaker: Jaheira
76.text: Did you think it would escape my notice forever? What you did to Isobel, in exchange for a little of your father's power?
76.context: NodeContext: Alt scroll branch - she now WILL keep it, because we've proven to be violent and a little psychopathic at times. No venom or accusation in this - she's partof it too.

43.speaker: Jaheira
43.text: I share my blame for pushing you down that path - for telling you that we must finish Ketheric at all costs.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira puts the scroll away (magic bum bag)

5.speaker: Jaheira
5.text: And I am not blind. We have all profited from the results - perhaps the entire world will, before all of this is done.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira puts the scroll away (magic bum bag)

100.speaker: Jaheira
100.text: But I have to believe that there is a better way.  So I will hold on to this for a little while, I think - and see which one of us is right.
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira puts the scroll away (magic bum bag)

88.speaker: Jaheira
88.text: Did you think it would escape my notice forever? That you would trade Isobel away, to bring us closer to our goal?
88.context: NodeContext: Alt scroll branch - she now WILL keep it, because we've proven to be violent and a little psychopathic at times. No venom or accusation in this - she's partof it too.

32.speaker: Jaheira
32.text: You have cleared every obstacle in your path. Done everything that could be asked of you, without fear or favour. And without any regard for the cost.
32.context: NodeContext: Alt scroll branch - she now WILL keep it, because we've proven to be violent and a little psychopathic at times. No venom or accusation in this - she's partof it too.

40.speaker: Jaheira
40.text: You will save us, of that I have no doubt, and I hope to be right by your side. But I have to believe the way we do it matters, too.
40.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

11.speaker: Jaheira
11.text: So I will hold onto this a little longer, I think, and linger on - to see which one of us is right.
11.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

102.text: You have no right to judge me, Jaheira.
102.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

84.speaker: Player
84.text: You have no right to judge me, Jaheira.
84.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

109.speaker: Jaheira
109.text: Perhaps not. But know that I judge myself every bit as harshly, for allowing this to come to pass.
109.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Everything I did was to save myself - save us all.
60.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

61.speaker: Jaheira
61.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Why stick around, if I'm so detestable?
20.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

111.speaker: Jaheira
111.text: Because you will save us all. And I still hope you might do it the right way.
111.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You know what I am, and you let me live.
73.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

121.speaker: Jaheira
121.text: And still will. Perhaps I could not stop you now, even if I wished it. But I hope I will not need to find out.
121.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

21.speaker: Player
21.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

10.speaker: Jaheira
10.text: You're right. We have probably wasted enough words on this matter.
10.context: NodeContext: Shrug, unmoved - she's as bad as we are, and plans to make up for it

98.speaker: Jaheira
98.text: Now come - our work isn't done yet.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I'd take every drop of life I could get - especially for the sake of Baldur's Gate.

110.speaker: Jaheira
110.text: I know you would. But once the city squeezed it from you, what would be left? Everyone who seizes at eternal life has some purpose, in the beginning.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I would be eternal if it meant keeping my people free from ghaik slavery.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I would be eternal if it meant destroying ghaik for my queen.

107.speaker: Jaheira
107.text: I do not doubt you would serve her forever - only that she would let you. Strangely enough, those who grasp eternal life rarely mean for others to share in it.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'd cling to life forever if it means I could keep Baldur's Gate safe.

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: A noble sentiment. But I wonder if it would not lose some of its lustre, over the long years.

46.speaker: Jaheira
46.text: I spent most of my life fighting those who tried to escape their end. Ketheric, Irenicus, Sarevok... that is not company I would like to keep.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Would you live on at any cost?

33.speaker: Player
33.text: It's only natural to want more life.

16.speaker: Jaheira
16.text: Of course. It is our way - just as as it is death's way to meet us along the path, gently oblivious to whatever it is we want.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: A little too philosophical for me.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Get over yourself, Harper. No one person can fix the world.

75.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
75.text: To accept death is to surrender.

78.speaker: Jaheira
78.text: And to fight it is to doom yourself to defeat.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: That's amazing, Jaheira. What can I do to help?

58.speaker: Player
58.text: And anyone can use this scroll...?

22.speaker: Jaheira
22.text: Any druid. So yes, you might aspire to it if you wished. But the scroll is not the ritual itself - only part of my research into how it is worked.

79.speaker: Jaheira
79.text: Any druid. But the scroll is not the ritual itself. Only part of my research on its working.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Ah, I understand. I'd want to stay young and pretty too.

120.speaker: Jaheira
120.text: Oh, you really think I'm pretty? Just a moment, while I remember how to bat my eyelashes.

77.speaker: Jaheira
77.text: It is not something you need concern yourself with. I've picked up stranger things in all my travels, trust me.

56.speaker: Jaheira
56.text: If you wish. It's possible I was a little too quick to judge. A little too caught up in ceremony.
56.context: NodeContext: Flat, giving us nothing. Last time we discussed this she stated her disapproval of us, and her mind hasn't changed.

47.speaker: Jaheira
47.text: If you wish. It's possible I was a little too quick to judge. A little too caught up in ceremony.
47.context: NodeContext: Flat, giving us nothing. Last time we discussed this she stated her disapproval of us, and her mind hasn't changed.

53.speaker: Jaheira
53.text: I cannot think what it is we have to talk about.
53.context: NodeContext: Flat, giving us nothing. Last time we discussed this she stated her disapproval of us, and her mind hasn't changed.
